lines.text: Because I love her and nothing else! It isn't a little loving. It isn't a fancy. It isn't something you'd turn on and off. It's everything I think and feel and want and know. And there's no room in me for anything else. And never will be again.
Why did you ask me here?
Perhaps of breaking his heart which would be murder wouldn't it...
What are you doing at this hour?
I wanted you to look at the moon and smell the fragrance of spring in the air.
I haven't the time to explain. But I'm convinced now that Ambrose was right. She not only murdered him but she's done her best to kill me too.
Every word you uttered in the church that afternoon was the truth. And with that letter, I'm positive I can prove it.
How else could she marry her lover and still keep possession of the estate?
